Content: For new students, the request must be sent by email to compta_etudiante@devinci.fr. For other students, it must be done on the portal in the “Finances” tab.

Title: Where can I find the payment schedule for the current year's tuition fees?
Content: The payment schedule and our bank details can be found on the invoice you can download from the "Finance" tab on the portal.

Title: Who should I contact if I want to resign?
Content: If you wish to resign, please contact the school by e-mail scolarite-esilv@devinci.fr or scolaremlv@devinci.fr.

Title: Am I entitled to the 10% allowance for siblings?
Content: Yes if the 2 students are in initial training (excluding work-study) at EMLV or ESILV or IIM.

Title: Does the scholarship discount apply to Restart students?
Content: For the time being, no.

Title: How can I get a drivers's license assistance for apprentices?
Content: Please contact CFA ILV cfa-ilv@devinci.fr

Title: Is international mobility compulsory?
Content: ESILV PGE : An international experience is compulsory, either in the form of an academic exchange or an internship abroad. EMLV PGE : The international mobility is compulsory during year 3. EMLV Bachelor : The international mobility is compulsory during 1 semester in year 2. Alternants ESILV : If you don't go abroad in your third year, the international mobility is compulsory in your 5th year: either within a company, or with ESILV. IIM : International mobility is not compulsory. Bachelors : International mobility is compulsory in the 2nd semester of the 2nd year of study.

Title: When can I go on an international exchange?
Content: ESILV PGE + Alternants : International exchange is possible during the 3rd or 5th year. For ESILV-EMLV double-degree students, studying abroad is compulsory in your 3rd year. EMLV PGE : You must spend one year abroad in 3rd year: one academic semester and one internship semester. You can also study abroad in the 5th year. EMLV Bachelor DIB : International Exchange is mandatory during the 2nd semester of the 2nd year. IIM : International exchange is possible in the 3rd or 5th year (depending on your major). Bachelor DIB : Studying abroad is compulsory in the 2nd semester of the 2nd year. You can also go abroad for a year in the 3rd year. Bachelor BIN : Studying abroad is compulsory in the 2nd semester of the 2nd year. You can also go abroad for a semester in 3rd year. Bachelor BTM : Studying abroad is compulsory in the 2nd semester of the 2nd year.

Title: Where can I go on an international exchange? Who can I contact for any questions?
Content: We invite you to log in to your profile via the "mobilité/mobility" tab to see our list of partners. For any questions, you can send a email to outgoing@devinci.fr.

Title: Can I do an exchange semester in a university that doesn't have a partnership with the school?
Content: The school offers you numerous partner universities, in which you can fulfill your semester abroad. Departure from a non-partner university can only be considered if the request is made before November of the year prior to departure.

Title: How does the study abroad committee select the student's destination?
Content: The destinations are allocated according to the students' ranking, their level of English and the order of their requested destinations.

Title: What is the required level of English proficiency for international departures?
Content: It depends on the partner universities. You'll find the language requirements for each university on the partner universities page on Sharepoint. It should be noted, however, that a B2 level in English is generally required for most destinations.

Title: Can I do several international exchanges?
Content: The school allows you to do one or two exchange semesters with a partner university abroad, but you can do your internship abroad during your syllabus.

Title: How can I validate my international experience?
Content: ESILV PGE : To validate your international experience, the school requires you to do either a university exchange for a minimum of one semester or an internship abroad for a minimum of 4 months. Alternants ESILV : To validate your international experience, the school requires you to do a minimum of 12 weeks abroad (either with your company, or during a study abroad semester).

Title: Can I change my assigned destination?
Content: It is not possible to change your destination. All assignments are nominative and definitive.

Title: Am I eligible for an international scholarship?
Content: For an academic departure, some students are eligible for the Erasmus+ Study grant. For international internships, you may qualify for an Erasmus+ Internship grant, subject to funding and eligibility. For more information, please visit our Sharepoint or contact bourses-internationales@devinci.fr.

Title: Is the internship compulsory for international students?
Content: If you stay for more than one semester and/or are in a degree-seeking program, the internship is compulsory. If you are staying only one semester, the internship is optional.

Title: How do I get my bachelor's degree equivalence certificate?
Content: You should contact your year supervisor

Title: As an international student, who should I contact for all administrative procedures (accommodation, insurance, visa, ...)?
Content: You should contact incoming@devinci.fr.

Title: What English level is required to be admitted to the 4th year?
Content: ESILV : B1+ level is required.

Title: What English level is required to be admitted to the 5th year?
Content: ESILV : B2- level is required.

Title: What English level is required to graduate?
Content: ESILV : B2+ level is required - Minimum 800 (TOEIC)/500 (TOEFL) EMLV : B level is required

Title: Does the school organise TOEFL/TOEIC test sessions?
Content: Yes, the school organises regular sessions at an external test centre. You can register for these with the Language Department. The first participation is free of charge. Contact: langues@devinci.fr.

Title: Is a TOEIC/TOEFL test taken outside of the school accepted to validate the language level?
Content: Yes, check the regulations for tests recognised by the school.

Title: Is enrolment to a second language (LV2 course) compulsory?
Content: You can register for a LV2 course but it is not compulsory.

Title: Can I withdraw from a LV2 course during the semester?
Content: If you choose LV2 course, you commit to the course for the semester.

Title: Does enrolling in LV2 course award bonus points?
Content: It doesn't.

Title: What level of French must an international student pass to graduate?
Content: B2 level is required.

Title: Are the orientation days mandatory?
Content: Yes, they are. During thoses days you will meet important people for your exchange (pedagogical referent, nurse, the Welcome Desk, etc.) as well as visit the campus and receive information on administrative procedures. The orientation days are the first days you are expected on campus.

Title: I will arrive later than the orientation, what should I do?
Content: You should warn us before hand and provide justification (delay with visa obtention, cancelled plane, family emergency, etc.) on our email address : incoming@devinci.fr.

Title: I realize that I'm not registered for a course. Who should I contact?
Content: You need to contact the school's education officer of your year or program at the student office.

Title: Can I take courses from different years or programs?
Content: No, at Léonard de Vinci, you do no create your course package, your chose a major / specialization with an already-made list of courses. You will not be able to add courses from other years or other majors.

Title: Where can I find my course list?
Content: You can find the course list here : https://www.devinci.fr/en/programmes/exchange-programmes/

Title: Where can I find my academic calendar?
Content: You can find your academic calendar here : https://www.devinci.fr/en/programmes/exchange-programmes/

Title: Where can I find my schedule?
Content: You will find your schedule on your student portal.

Title: Is it mandatory to follow all classes from my program?
Content: For degree-seeking or double-diploma students, it is mandatory to follow all your prescribed classes. Exchange students, on the other hand, are allowed to unregister from certain classes if they provide an explicit and written approval from their sending institution.

Title: Can I drop some classes?
Content: Only exchange students are allowed to drop classes if they have the authorization from their sending institution. At the beggining of the semester, you will be expected to communicate the courses you wish to drop and send us a written and explicit confirmation from you sending institution at our email address : incoming@devinci.fr. Only the requests that respect our deadline will be taken into account.

Title: When will I receive my grades?
Content: Once ready, your grades will be updated on your student portal.

Title: What is the procedure if I need a 30% additional time?
Content: You have to discuss with the department's disability advisor and provide the necessary medical documents.

Title: Is there a deadline to declare my need of additional time?
Content: You can declare it at the beginning of each semester.

Title: Can an internship start before the internship period ?
Content: Your internship can't begin on the date indicated in your calendar. The only exception at ESILV : A5 students in semester 9 abroad can start their internship at the end of their semester. At EMLV, this exception extends to the 3rd year abroad internship when the first semester of the 3rd year is an exchange semester. The same explanation applies the other way round: the Ministry of Higher Education prohibits internships outside periods identified as such in the academic calendar. This does not apply when your academic year takes place abroad (an exchange semester and an internship semester), as local regulations apply.

Title: What is the deadline to complete my internship?
Content: Depending on your year, a maximum and minimum duration are indicated in your calendar. Legally, an internship cannot exceed 6 months. If you started your end-of-studies internship late, subject to re-registration, you may complete it after August 31, without exceeding the deadline for preparing and sitting on the diploma jury (please contact your school: scolarité-emlv@devinci.fr or scoalrite-esilv@devinci.fr).

Title: What are the expectations at the end of the internship?
Content: For the A2 compulsory internship, you must submit an internship report, plus complete a defense for the mandatory internships in A4 and A5.

Title: I am at the end of my course (S11 / A6), what should I do to prepare for the internship defense?
Content: You must contact your school tutor (on the portal, internship section) and organise a remote defense between the two of you.

Title: Are CDD (fixed term contract) / CDI (permanent contract) / VIE (international company volunteering) accepted?
Content: The CDD/CDI (fixed-term / permanent contracts) and VIE are a possible alternative to internship agreements, subject to the acceptance of your assignments by your major supervisor/year advisor, and subject to the company's agreement to evaluate you and assign you a tutor within the company to supervise your work.

Title: Where can I find VIE offers?
Content: The main website is https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/offres. You can find them at https://www.pole-emploi.fr/international/mobilite-internationale.html as well as on corporate career sites.

Title: My agreement is signed, how can I modify it?
Content: In this case, initiate a request via the internship platform and the comment tab. Please note that each modification request will trigger the edition of a rider and will require once again the signature of all three parties: student, company and school.

Title: My agreement is not signed by all three parties, how can I change it?
Content: You must (you or the company) refuse the signature so that we can proceed to the requested modifications. Please specify all the changes you wish to make in the comment section.

Title: What is the minimum gratification for an internship lasting more than 2 months?
Content: As of January 1, 2023, the legal minimum gratification is 4,05 euros per hour.

Title: What is the minimum gratification for an internship lasting less than 2 months?
Content: There is no legal minimum for an internship of less than 2 month.

Title: Is the internship compulsory in the first year?
Content: The internship is optional for first year students, however it can be an opportunity to familiarise yourself with the business world (ESILV). The internship is compulsory for first year students (EMLV).

Title: Can I do an internship abroad?
Content: Yes, in this case an agreement is required, but the law of the country will apply to the terms of the internship.

Title: Can I do a full remote internship?
Content: Full company immersion with regular support from a tutor is necessary.

Title: What should I do in case of absences?
Content: In case of absence you must inform the company and the school.

Title: What happens if I don't find an internship?
Content: The school provides several means (forum, soft skills courses, offers,...). If you encounter some difficulties, you should contact your major/specialization supervisor and the career center. Eventually, if your search is unsuccessful, you will have to re-enrol at the end of your course to complete the necessary duration of the internship in a company.

Title: Can I start my internship without the signed agreement?
Content: Legally, it is forbidden to start an internship without the agreement being signed beforehand by all three parties. This puts you (and the company) in an untenable situation in the event of an accident at work (or on the way to work).

Title: Can I obtain several internship agreements during the same academic year?
Content: Only one agreement is issued per student per year, except in the case of a gap year when it is possible to obtain two.

Title: Who validates the assignments of my internship?
Content: Your major/specialization supervisor or year supervisor.

Title: What is the procedure in order to obtain an agreement?
Content: You will find the agreement application form on your platform.

Title: My company wishes to publish its own internship agreement, is this possible?
Content: If your company does not accept the school's agreement, it can issue its own. Please do not forget to mention this beforehand when entering your application.

Title: Which documents are required for an internship abroad?
Content: Before your internship abroad, you must provide the school with a certificate of civil liability and repatriation insurance with your name and surname covering the duration of the internship.

Title: How long does it take to get my agreement?
Content: In general, it takes one week to process a complete application. Take this information into account when determining your starting date with the company.

Title: What is the procedure if I wish to terminate my internship?
Content: The agreements are tripartite contracts. The student must discuss this beforehand with his/her major / specialization supervisor and see how to arrange the situation. If no arrangement is found, the company must confirm its agreement to leave by email, sent directly to the school scolarite-emlv@devinci.fr or scolarite-esilv@devinci.fr

Title: I'm repeating a year and I've already validated my internship. Do I have to do it again if I'm repeating a year?
Content: This is specified by the grading jury at the end of the academic year.. The answer may vary from course.

Title: In 3rd year, can I do the exchange and internship in the same country?
Content: Yes, it's possible. The exchange semester that generally precedes the internship semester can be an opportunity to prospect locally.

Title: Where can I find a list of countries that are unsafe for internships?
Content: The reference site: https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fr/conseils-aux-voyageurs/conseils-par-pays-destination/. Please note that the school will not validate an internship in an unfavorable destination.

Title: What is the "attestation de reponsabilité civile" (certificate of civil liability)?
Content: A certificate of personal civil liability provides proof to an organisation that the person they are going to host is covered in case of damage to a third party. In general, the civil liability certificate that you are asked to provide is attached to your home insurance. It must be in your first and last name and cover the period of your internship.

Title: You would like to I declare a disability? or renew your adjustments?
Content: You must contact the pole's disability advisor via handi@devinci.fr. There is an open office every tuesday and thursday from 2:00pm to 5:00pm. Room I402 (4th floor of the learning center)

Title: Where can I go if I have a Health problem?
Content: The infirmary is located in room E200, it is open every tuesday, wednesday and thursday from 9:00am to 12:30pm and every wednesday afternoon from 2:00pm to 4:30pm.

Title: In case of a medical emergency who should I contact at the Leonard de Vinci pole?
Content: Whether it is vital or not, call pole security at 01 41 16 72 00. The pole security will contact the SAMU directly.

Title: you need to see or talk to a psychologist
Content: A psychologist is present every thursday at the pole from 2:00pm to 5:00 pm, room E200 or you can call 0 800 730 891 for free on line anonymous consultation.

Title: What do I do if I am victim or witness of harassment or sexist and sexual violence?
Content: Please contact your school supervisor, the nurse and/or psychological helpline. You can also report the fact directly on www.leonarddevinci.signalement.net

Title: Is there a cafeteria in the pole?
Content: Food areas with microwaves and vending machines are available to students on all our campus

Title: Does the pole offer housing?
Content: Our partner studapart, a housing plateform offers several types of housing with some reserved spots.

Title: If I lose something at the centre, who should I contact?
Content: You should ask at the security desk at the entrance of the pole. You can also post a yammer message in the "lost property" group.

Title: If I notice any damage, who should I contact?
Content: You can contact: sg@devinci.fr

Title: If a classroom is too hot or not hot enough, who should I contact?
Content: You can contact: sg@devinci.fr

Title: If I find an item, who should I bring it to?
Content: You can post on Yammer and drop the item to the "Scolarité"/Education Department

Title: From which projects can I be exempted if I am "Grand Associatif"/active member of an association?
Content: The Direction of Associative Life takes the decision at the beginning of each year, according to your mandates.

Title: What are the opening hours of the sport halls at the Pole
Content: Sport halls are available to students free of charge outside the Pole's closing period : Monday and Wednesday: from 12:15pm to 2pm and from 5:30pm to 7:15pm Tuesday and Friday: 11:30am to 3pm and 5:30pm to 7:15pm

Title: Where is the sport department?
Content: The sports department is located on the 4th Floor of the Learning Center: office I.401. Email : sports@devinci.fr. Celine GRAET: 01.81.00.27.38

Title: I have a sport exemption, what should I do?
Content: You must email your certificate to sports@devinci.fr. If it is a long-term exemption, you will no longer have sport. If it is a short-term exemption, your absences from sport over this period will be excused over the period mentioned.

Title: I am a high-level athlete, what are my adjustments?
Content: Please contact Céline Graet : celine.graet@devinci.fr

Title: Do you need tutoring? Where can you find it?
Content: Leo Learning, the solidarity tutoring association, organizes individual support courses and weeks of collective revisions before the exams. Registration on the leolearning.fr platform with LeoID identifiers.

Title: How to join a student association?
Content: The contacts the 60 student associations boards are listed on the Student Life website on the portal. Two recruitment highlights in the year : an association fair organized in September and January. Several associations recruit throughout the year. Link: https://devinci.sharepoint.com/sites/VAS/SitePages/La-Vie-Associative.aspx?web=1

Title: How to create a student association?
Content: Make sure it doesn't already exist. And inform the Student life of the creation project by email: vie.associative@devinci.fr

Title: Is there a buddy system?
Content: Each school club set up a sponsorship system at the start of the year to facilitate the integration of new students. Links : venivididevinci@devinci.fr ; iimpact@devinci.fr ; vincisquad@devinci.fr

Title: Quelles sont les horaires et jours d'ouverture de la salle de sport ?
Content: Tous les jours exceptés les jeudis, les jours fériés, le week-end et pendant les vacances scolaires. 12h15 - 14h00 et 17h30 - 19h15

Title: Comment se rendre aux différents campus ?
Content:
• PARIS
    • Campus du Pôle Léonard de Vinci : 12 Avenue Léonard de Vinci, 92400 Courbevoie
    • Campus de l’Arche : 47 boulevard de Pesaro, 92000 Nanterre
    • Campus des Terrasses : 32 rue des 3 Fontanot, 92000 Nanterre
    • Campus Cyber : 5-7 rue Bellini, 92800 La Défense
  • NANTES
    • Campus de la Chantrerie : 9 Rue Alfred Kastler, 44300 Nantes

Title: Définition des Soft Skills
Content:
Ce sont des compétences humaines et des qualités personnelles, liées par exemple à notre façon de penser et d’appréhender le monde, comme à nos émotions et à nos relations avec les autres , ainsi qu’à nos modes d’action et de décision . Les « softs kills » sont valorisés dans le monde professionnel , en complément des « hard skills » que sont les connaissances et savoir-faire scientifiques et techniques.
L’objectif est de proposer aux étudiants de l’EMLV, de l’ESILV et de l’IIM un critère de différenciation supplémentaire, par rapport à d’autres candidats de même profil technique.

Title: Je suis positif/ve Covid, que dois je faire?
Content:
Depuis le 1er février 2023, l’isolement n’est plus systématique. Il est néanmoins recommandé de privilégier le travail en distanciel, quand c’est possible, de continuer à respecter les gestes barrières et d’éviter tout contact avec des personnes fragiles.
Les symptômes du Covid-19 disparaissent en quelques jours avec du repos. En attendant, vous devez surveiller votre santé et l’aggravation de vos symptômes.
  • Si vous êtes une personne fragile : consultez rapidement votre médecin, il pourra vous prescrire un traitement contre le virus en comprimés.
  • En cas de doute ou de symptôme inhabituels, consultez votre médecin traitant.
  • Si vous avez des difficultés à respirer, contactez immédiatement le 15.

Title: I tested positive for COVID-19, what should I do?
Content:
Since February 1, 2023, isolation is no longer mandatory. However, it is still recommended to prioritize remote work whenever possible, to continue practicing social distancing measures, and to avoid contact with vulnerable individuals.
COVID-19 symptoms typically resolve within a few days with rest. In the meantime, you should monitor your health and any worsening of your symptoms. If you are a vulnerable individual: promptly consult your doctor, who can prescribe antiviral medication in pill form. If you have any doubts or experience unusual symptoms, consult your primary care physician. If you have difficulty breathing, immediately contact 911 (or the emergency number in your region)." Please note that emergency numbers may vary by country or region, so it's important to replace "15" with the appropriate emergency number for your location if necessary.

Title: Defining Soft Skills
Content: These are human skills and personal qualities, linked, for example, to our way of thinking and understanding the world, our emotions and our relationships with others, as well as our modes of action and decision-making. Soft skills' are valued in the professional world as a complement to 'hard skills', i.e. scientific and technical knowledge and know-how. The aim is to offer EMLV, ESILV and IIM students an additional criterion for differentiation from other candidates with the same technical profile.

Title: COVID -Je suis cas contact avec une personne testée positive, que dois-je faire ?
Content:
Vérifié le 01 février 2023 - Direction de l'information légale et administrative (Première ministre)

Vous avez été en contact avec une personne qui vient d'être testée positive à la Covid-19. ?

Doit-on s'isoler?

Non, vous n'avez pas l'obligation de vous isoler.

Toutefois, il est recommandé :

  • de respecter les gestes barrières
  • et d'éviter tout contact avec des personnes fragiles.
Doit-on faire un test de dépistage ?

Depuis le 1er février 2023, si vous avez été en contact avec une personne testée positive à la Covid-19, vous n'avez plus l'obligation de réaliser un test de dépistage (autotest, RT-PCR ou test antigénique) au bout de 2 jours.

Toutefois, le test de dépistage est recommandé, notamment si vous constatez l'apparition de symptômes (maux de tête, température, etc.).

Rappel:

Si le résultat de votre test est positif à la Covid-19, il est recommandé de vous isoler et de prévenir vos proches. Depuis le 1er février 2023, le service géré par l'Assurance maladie, qui permettait de prévenir les personnes avec lesquelles vous aviez été en contact, n'est plus actif.

Title: COVID - I am in contact with someone who has tested positive, what should I do?
Content:
Verified on February 1, 2023 - Directorate of Legal and Administrative Information (Prime Minister's Office)
You have been in contact with someone who has recently tested positive for COVID-19. Do you need to isolate? You are not obligated to isolate. However, it is recommended:
  • To observe social distancing measures.
  • And to avoid contact with vulnerable individuals.
Do you need to get tested? As of February 1, 2023, if you have been in contact with a person who tested positive for COVID-19, you are no longer required to undergo a testing (self-test, RT-PCR, or antigen test) after 2 days. Nevertheless, testing is recommended, especially if you experience the onset of symptoms (headaches, fever, etc.). Reminder: If your test result is positive for COVID-19, it is recommended to isolate yourself and inform your close contacts. Since February 1, 2023, the service managed by the Health Insurance, which used to notify individuals you had been in contact with, is no longer active

Title: COVID -J’ai les symptômes, que dois-je faire ?
Content:
Si vous ressentez des symptômes d’infection respiratoire aigüe (fièvre, toux, essoufflement, courbature, fatigue, perte du goût ou de l’odorat…), vous devez :
1 – Réaliser un test de dépistage Depuis le 1er mars 2023, l’Assurance maladie prend en charge une partie des frais liés aux tests de dépistage (antigénique et RT-PCR) du Covid-19 de tous ses assurés sans prescription, par le biais d’un ticket modérateur. 2 – Respecter les gestes barrières
  • Porter un masque. Le masque FFP2 est recommandé pour les publics les plus fragiles.
  • Se laver régulièrement les mains à l’eau et au savon.
  • Aérer les pièces.
  • Limiter les contacts en particulier avec les personnes fragiles et à risque de formes graves.

Title: COVID - I have the symptoms, what should I do?
Content:
If you experience symptoms of acute respiratory infection (fever, cough, shortness of breath, body aches, fatigue, loss of taste or smell, etc.), you should:
  1. Take an antigen test, a self-test, or an RT-PCR test.To find testing locations in Île-de-France, visit sante.fr. To learn more about the different types of tests and their coverage.
Since March 1, 2023, Health Insurance covers a portion of the testing expenses (antigen and RT-PCR) for COVID-19 for all its insured individuals without a prescription, through a co-payment system.
  1. Adhere to the preventive measuresWear a mask. FFP2 masks are recommended for the most vulnerable populations. Wash your hands regularly with soap and water. Ventilate indoor spaces. Limit close contacts, especially with vulnerable individuals and those at risk of severe illness.

Title: COVID - Un camarade de ma classe m’a dit qu’il était positif , que dois-je faire ?
Content:
Vérifié le 01 février 2023 - Direction de l'information légale et administrative (Première ministre)

Vous avez été en contact avec une personne qui vient d'être testée positive à la Covid-19. ?

Title: COVID - A classmate told me that he tested positive, what should I do?
Content:
Verified on February 1, 2023 - Directorate of Legal and Administrative Information (Prime Minister's Office) You have been in contact with someone who has recently tested positive for COVID-19. Do you need to isolate? You are not obligated to isolate. However, it is recommended:
  • To observe social distancing measures.
  • And to avoid contact with vulnerable individuals.
Do you need to get tested? As of February 1, 2023, if you have been in contact with a person who tested positive for COVID-19, you are no longer required to undergo a testing (self-test, RT-PCR, or antigen test) after 2 days. Title: COVID - Je suis alternant, quelles sont les consignes pour moi ?
Content: Quand je suis en période de cours au Pôle :Les directives sanitaire que je sois cas confirmé, cas contact ou cas symptomatique sont les mêmes que pour un étudiant non alternant : je me réfère aux items de la FAQ qui me concernent. Si je suis en arrêt de travail, je suis noté absent et ne peux participer aux évaluations de cours. L’absence sera notifiée dans mon relevé d’absences et le certificat enregistré dans mon dossier. Quand je suis en période entreprise :Je suis salarié de mon entreprise, j’en suis les règles ; qui peuvent donc différer d’une structure à l’autre. Je me rapproche de mon manager pour avoir les consignes à suivre.Dans le cas où la procédure de votre entreprise diffère de celle du Pôle. Vous devez mettre en place celle de votre entreprise.

Title: COVID -I'm a work-study student, what are the instructions for me?
Content:
When you are in class at the Pole:
The health guidelines whether you are a confirmed case, a contact case or a symptomatic case are the same as for a non-rotating student: you refer to the items in the FAQ that concern you.
If I am off work, I will be marked absent and will not be able to participate in the course evaluations. The absence will be notified in my absence statement and the certificate will be registered in my file.
When you are on a business trip:
You are an employee of your company, you follow the rules, which may differ from one structure to another. You approach your manager to get the instructions to follow.
If your company's procedure differs from that of the Pôle. You must implement your company's procedure.

Title: COVID - Je suis étudiant, je suis cas positif, contact ou symptomatique, qui dois-je contacter ?
Content: Vous pouvez rédiger un mail à la scolarité de votre école : Scolarité EMLV : scolaremlv@devinci.fr Scolarité ESILV : scolarite-esilv@devinci.fr Scolarité IIM : scolariteiim@devinci.fr et mettre en copie Elena Niati (Référente santé / infirmière du Pôle) : elena.niati@devinci.fr si besoin de réévaluer votre cas clinique ultérieurement.

Title: COVID - I am a student, I am a confirmed case, a contact case or a symptomatic case, who should I contact?
Content:
You can send an e-mail to your school's registrar:
EMLV School: scolaremlv@devinci.fr ESILV School: scolarite-esilv@devinci.fr IIM School: scolariteiim@devinci.fr and send a copy to Elena Niati (Health referent / Pôle nurse): elena.niati@devinci.fr if you need to reassess your clinical case later.

Title: Que faire si je suis victime ou témoin de violences sexistes et sexuelles ?
Content: Vous pouvez signaler les faits sur la plateforme www.leonarddevinci.signalement.net, un RV avec les référents VSS vous sera proposé aussitôt. En complément, vous pouvez vous rapprocher de la référente santé ou de la cellule d’écoute psychologique du pôle : le jeudi après-midi sur site, ou par visio, chat ou téléphone avec Pros-Consulte.

Title: What should I do if I am a victim or witness of sexual or gender-based violence?
Content: You can report the facts on the www.leonarddevinci.signalement.net platform, and an appointment with the VSS referents will be proposed to you shortly. In addition, you can contact the health referent or the de Vinci Higher Education listening cell : on-campus on Thursday afternoons, or with Pros-Consulte by video, chat or telephone.

Title: Quelle est l’adresse de la plateforme de signalement de violences sexistes et sexuelles ?
Content: La plateforme externe est accessible sur : www.leonarddevinci.signalement.net

Title: What is the address of the platform for reporting sexual or gender-based violence?
Content: The external platform can be accessed at: www.leonarddevinci.signalement.net

Title: Qu’est-ce qu’un référent VSS ?
Content: Au pôle, il existe des référents VSS, membres du personnel dont la mission est de faire de la prévention et d’accompagner les étudiants victimes ou témoins de violences sexistes et sexuelles, et des correspondants VSS dans chaque cursus. Au sein des associations, il existe également des référents VSS associatifs formés pour participer aux actions de prévention.

Title: What is a VSS (SGBV) referent?
Content: At De Vinci Higher Education, there are VSS referents, members of staff whose mission is to prevent and support students who are victims or witnesses of sexual and gender-based violence, and VSS correspondents in each curriculum. Within the associations, there are also VSS referents trained to take part in prevention actions.

Title: Comment savoir si je suis victime de VSS ou témoin d’abus ?
Content: Le document intitulé « Lutte contre les violences sexistes et sexuelles, prévention et procédure de signalement » disponible sur le portail vous permet de connaître les différents abus.

Title: How do I know if I'm a victim or witness of abuse?
Content: The document entitled "Lutte contre les violences sexistes et sexuelles, prévention et procédure de signalement" ("Fighting against sexual and gender-based violence, prevention and reporting procedures") available on the portal helps you find out about the various types of abuse.

Title: J’ai fait un signalement de violences sexistes et sexuelles, que se passe-t-il après ?
Content: Vous recevrez un message des référents VSS pour organiser une rencontre. Si les faits se sont produits en milieu étudiant, les référents VSS se rapprocheront des correspondants VSS du cursus pour évaluer la situation et la soumettre à une cellule de décision. Les membres de la cellule de décision prendront les mesures nécessaires. Si les faits se sont produits en milieu professionnel, le pôle ne pourra pas intervenir, il faudra vous rapprocher de votre employeur.

Title: I've reported sexual and gender-based violence, what happens next?
Content: You will receive a message from the VSS referents to arrange a meeting. If the incident occurred in a student environment, the VSS referents will contact the curriculum’s VSS correspondent to assess the situation and submit it to a decision-making committee. The members of the decision-making committee will take the necessary measures. If the incident occurred in the workplace, De Vinci Higher Education will not be able to intervene ; you will need to contact your employer.

Title: Dans une situation de violences sexistes et sexuelles, est-ce que je dois porter plainte ?
Content: Le dépôt de plainte est une démarche personnelle qui est indépendante de la procédure du pôle. Il n’est pas nécessaire d’avoir porté plainte auprès des autorités de police pour faire un signalement sur notre plateforme www.leonarddevinci.signalement.net

Title: Should I file a complaint in the event of gender-based or sexual violence?
Content: Filing a complaint is a personal process that is independent of de Vinci Higher Education’s procedure. You do not need to have filed a complaint with the police authorities to report a case on our www.leonarddevinci.signalement.net platform.

Title: Qui sont les correspondants VSS à l’ESILV ?
Content: Vous pouvez vous rapprocher des correspondants VSS : Blandine JARRY (Responsable scolarité), Najet ASSAKI (A1 sauf restart), Carine VAN DER GUCHT (A2/restart), Cindy VALLÉE (Nantes), Bastien LEJEUNE (A3), Catherine BEIGNET (A4), Irène BLANQUART (A5), Samira ESSARDY (A4/A5 alternance), Sarah MASSUELLES (étudiants internationaux), Laurence LEGRAND (Bachelor)

Title: Who are the VSS correspondent for ESILV students?
Content: You can contact the VSS correspondents: Blandine JARRY (Head of the administrative office), Najet ASSAKI (Y1 except restart), Carine VAN DER GUCHT (Y2/restart), Cindy VALLÉE (Nantes campus), Bastien LEJEUNE (Y3), Catherine BEIGNET (Y4), Irène BLANQUART (Y5), Samira ESSARDY (Y4/Y5 apprendice), Sarah MASSUELLES (international students), Laurence LEGRAND (Bachelor)

Title: Qui sont les correspondants VSS à l’EMLV ?
Content: Vous correspondants VSS sont vos référents scolarité d’année à l’EMLV.

Title: Who are the VSS correspondent for EMLV students?
Content: Your VSS correspondents are your EMLV year-long schooling referents.

Title: Qui sont les correspondants VSS à l’IIM ?
Content: Vous pouvez vous rapprocher des correspondants VSS : Aurélie ROBERT (Responsable administration pédagogique), Alexandre ABRANTES (Professeur délégué axe Animation 3D), Mickael GARIMÉ (Responsable pédagogique - A1 Bachelor et Restart), Garance CHEVAUX (Professeure déléguée – A1 Bachelor et Restart), Marie BERNARD (Chargée de projets), Matthieu COUSQUER (Campus Nantes

Title: Comment s'inscrire/se désinscrire d'un évènement de promotion?
Content: Vous pouvez vous inscrire à un évènement de promotion en vous inscrivant sur la plateforme. En cas d'inscription par erreur, vous devez contacter le service à l'initiative de l'évènement par mail.

Title: Je n'arrive pas à me mettre présent, que faire ?
Content: Si vous rencontrez un dysfonctionnement sur l'application mobile, vous devez utiliser le portail web www.leonard-de-vinci.net. Vous pouvez également envoyer une demande d'aide pour signaler le problème.

Title: L'application mobile a-t-elle les mêmes fonctionnalités que le portail web ?
Content: Non, l'application mobile est une version simplifiée du portail étudiant et ne remplacera jamais la version web.

Title: Does the mobile application have the same functionality as the web portal?
Content: No, the mobile application is a simplified version of the student portal and will never replace the web version.

Title: I can't mark myself as present. What should I do?
Content: If you encounter a bug on the mobile application, you should use the web portal www.leonard-de-vinci.net. You can also send a request for help to report the problem.

Title: Quelle est la durée hebdomadaire d’un stage en France ?
Content: "Durée hebdomadaire" signifie durée sur la semaine (en général 35 heures hors pause déjeuner, durée légale en France)

Title: What is the weekly duration of an internship in France?
Content: "Durée hebdomadaire" means duration over the week (generally 35 hours without lunch break, legal duration in France).

Title: Puis-je valider un stage A4 effectué en S11 par un CDI ?
Content: Si vous n'avez pas encore effectué votre stage de A4, vous devrez le réaliser après votre stage de fin d'études (en S11). Désormais, vous ne pouvez plus remplacer ce stage A4 par un CDI après le stage A5 (c’était une exception liée à la période covid).

Title: Can I validate an A4 internship completed in S11 with a permanent contract (CDI)?
Content: If you have not yet done your 4th year internship, you will have to do it after your end-of-study internship (in S11). You can no longer replace this internship with a permanent contract after your A5 internship. It was an exception during covid.

Title: Quelle est la durée maximale pour un stage en France ?
Content: Un stage en France ne peut dépasser 6 mois (droit du travail)

Title: What is the maximum length of an internship in France?
Content: An internship in France cannot exceed 6 months (it’s the French law).

Title: L’entreprise souhaite une charte de confidentialité, quelle est la procédure ?
Content: Si l’entreprise souhaite mettre en place une charte de confidentialité ou équivalent, elle la transmet à l’étudiant stagiaire qui se chargera de la faire signer par l’école (en général, c’est le tuteur école qui doit signer, pas la direction).

Title: The company would like a confidentiality policy. What is the procedure?
Content: If the company wishes to set up a confidentiality policy or equivalent, it sends it to the student who will be responsible to have it signed by the school (usually, the school tutor must sign, not the management).

Title: Je suis en double-diplôme, dois-je saisir ma convention sur le portail ?
Content: Pour les double-diplômes, même si le stage est compris dans le cursus de l'université partenaire, vous devez compléter le formulaire sur la webapps en indiquant "convention fournie par l'organisme/l’unviersité partenaire ».

Title: I'm doing a double degree. Do I need to enter my agreement on the portal?
Content: For double degrees, even if the internship is included in the course of the partner university, you must complete the form on webapps/portal, indicating "agreement provided by the partner/university organization“.

Title: Un stage à l’international peut-il valider la période de mobilité obligatoire ?
Content: Un stage à l’international peut valider la période de mobilité obligatoire sous réserve qu’il dure 17 semaines à minima (recommandé 20 semaines).

Title: Can an international internship count towards the compulsory mobility period?
Content: An international internship can count towards the compulsory mobility period, provided that it lasts at least 17 weeks (recommended 20 weeks).

Title: Quelle est la procédure en cas changement de tuteur entreprise?
Content: Vous devez contacter alterance-esilv@devinci.fr

Title: What procedure should I follow if my company tutor changes?
Content: You must contact alternance-esilv@devinci.fr

Title: Quelle est la procédure pour rompre un contrat d'alternance après la période d'essai?
Content: Dans un premier temps, avant toute initiative de rupture, vous devez impérativement en informer alternance-esilv@devinci.fr et votre tuteur école.

Title: What is the procedure for terminating a work-study contract after the trial period?
Content: First of all, before taking any initiative to break off your contract, you must inform alternance-esilv@devinci.fr and your school tutor.

Title: Quelle est la procédure pour rompre un contrat d'alternance pendant la période d'essai?
Content: Vous devez adresser le formulaire de rupture au CFA et à l'adresse alternance-esilv@devinci.fr

Title: What is the procedure for terminating a work-study contract during the trial period?
Content: You must send the termination form to the CFA and at alternance-esilv@devinci.fr.

Title: Quelle est la durée minimum de l'expérience internationale dans le cadre de l'aternance?
Content: La durée minimale est de 9 semaines pour valider l'expérience à l'international dans le cadre de l'alternance.

Title: What is the minimum length of the international experience required as part of an apprenticeship?
Content: The minimum duration is 9 weeks to validate the international experience in the context of work-study programs.

Title: Dans le cadre de l'entreprise, le fait d'échanger quotidiennement avec des équipes à l'étranger valide t-il l'expérience international?
Content: Non, l'expérience internationale ne se limite pas à la pratique de la langue.

Title: In the company context, does the fact of exchanging daily with teams from other countries validate the international experience?
Content: No, international experience isn't limited to language practice.

Title: Comment puis-je me procurer une convocation aux examens pour poser des jours de révisions?
Content: Vous devez en faire la demande à alternance-esilv@devinci.fr

Title: How can I obtain an exam convocation so that I can schedule revision days?
Content: Please send your request to alternance-esilv@devinci.fr

Title: Comment obtenir l'aide financière au permis de conduire?
Content: Vous devez contacter le CFA cfa-ilv@devinci.fr

Title: How can I apply for financial assistance for my driver's license?
Content: You must contact the CFA at cfa-ilv@devinci.fr

Title: Comment obtenir l'aide financière à la mobilité internationale?
Content: Vous devez contacter le CFA cfa-ilv@devinci.fr

Title: How can I apply for financial assistance for international mobility?
Content: You must contact the CFA at cfa-ilv@devinci.fr

Title: Mon livret d'apprentissage n'est pas complet, que dois-je faire?
Content: Vous êtes garant du suivi et de la complétude de votre livret. N’hésitez à pas relancer vos tuteurs pour cela. Vous devez vous assurez que votre maitre d'apprentissage a bien accès au portail (en début d'année un mail lui a été envoyé). Vous devez coordonner les échanges etre votre tuteur école et votre maitre d'apprentissage. Vous devez vous assurer que chaque étape est signée par tous les partis (coche bleu) En cas de soucis contacter : - ESILV : alternance-esilv@devincifr Rappel, des ects sont attribués à votre livret et donc l'obtention de votre diplôme.

Title: My apprenticeship booklet is incomplete. What should I do?
Content: You are in charge of the follow up of your booklet and its completion. Don't hesitate to remind your tutors.

Title: Mon tuteur école ne répond pas à mes sollicitations, que dois-je faire?
Content: Vous devez en informer alterance-esilv@devinci.fr

Title: My school tutor doesn't respond to my enquiries. What should I do?
Content: You must notify alternance-esilv@devinci.fr

Title: Où puis-je trouver ma convention de mobilité?
Content: Vous trouverez votre convention de mobilité sur votre portail dans l'onglet "Scolarité" puis "Documents", catégorie "Apprentissage"

Title: Where can I find my mobility agreement?
Content: You can find your mobility agreement on your student portal in the "School" tab, "Documents" category, then "Apprentissage/apprenticeship"

Title: Quelle est la différence entre "Date limite" et "Date butoir" ?
Content: La "Date limite" représente la date limite pour soumettre un travail, tandis que la "Date butoir" représente la date à laquelle l'activité n'est plus accessible. Il est conseillé de ne pas activer la Date Butoir. Si jamais il y a des restrictions, utilisez d'autres possibilités dans Moodle pour le faire. Consultez Créer un devoir.

Title: What is the difference between "Due Date" and "Cut-off date"?
Content: The "Due Date" represents the date by which a job must be submitted, while the "Cut off date" represents the date by which the activity can no longer be accessed. We advise you not to activate the Deadline. If there are any restrictions, use other options in Moodle to do so. See Create an assignment.

Title: Comment accéder à mes cours dans De Vinci Learning ?
Content:
Une fois connecté, vous serez dirigé vers votre tableau de bord de De Vinci Learning.
Sur le tableau de bord, vous devriez voir une liste de vos cours. Cliquez sur le titre du cours auquel vous souhaitez accéder.
Sur la vue des cours, vous disposez de plusieurs filtres que vous pouvez utiliser (Année scolaire, cursus, semestre et domaines).
Vous pouvez ajuster votre recherche par le biais des filtres et faire une recherche manuelle dans la barre dédiée : Aussi, si vous ne retrouvez pas votre cours, appuyez sur le bouton "réinitialiser" afin de remettre vos filtres à zéro. Il est probable qu'un filtre vous empêche de proprement trouver le cours souhaité.

Title: How do I access my courses in De Vinci Learning?
Content: Once you have logged in, you will be directed to your De Vinci Learning dashboard. On the dashboard, you should see a list of your courses. Click on the title of the course you wish to access. On the course view, you have several filters you can use (Academic year, curriculum, semester and subject areas). You can adjust your search using the filters and do a manual search in the dedicated bar: Also, if you can't find your course, press the "reset" button to reset your filters to zero. It is likely that a filter is preventing you from properly finding the course you want.

Title: Pourquoi il y a une mention "Marquer comme terminé" dans les activités de mon cours ?
Content: La mention "Marquer comme terminé" permet aux étudiants de suivre leur progression dans le cours en indiquant les activités qu'ils ont achevées. Selon les paramètres de l'activité, l'étudiant peut l'indiquer lui même en cliquant sur le bouton ou alors l'indicateur d'achèvement prend automatiquement en compte la progression lors de la consultation. Vous pouvez gérer ces comportements dans les paramètres de l'activité sous la catégorie "Achèvement d'activité"

Title: Why is there a "Mark as done" message in my course activities?
Content: The "Mark as done" option allows students to track their progress in the course by indicating which activities they have completed. Depending on the activity's settings, students can either indicate this themselves by clicking on the button, or the completion indicator automatically takes progress into account when viewing the activity. You can manage these behaviors in the activity settings under the "Activity completion" category.

Title: Où trouver nos tutoriels De Vinci Learning ?
Content:
Pour les enseignants suivez le cours Créer son cours sur Devinci Learning et les étudiants pourront suivre le cours Prendre en main Devinci Learning.

Vous pouvez également relancer les visites guidées sur DVL en cliquant sur le "?" en bas de chaque page. Si une visite guidée devait se lancer sur cette page, alors elle réapparaitra :

Title: Where can I find our Vinci Learning tutorials?
Content: Teachers can follow the Create your course on De Vinci Learning course, while students can follow the Getting started with De Vinci Learning course. You can also restart guided tours on DVL by clicking on the "?" at the bottom of each page. If a tour should start on this page, it will reappear:

Title: Comment rédiger du contenu en LaTeX sur De Vinci Learning ?
Content: Dans l'édition de texte, cliquez sur le bouton "Afficher plus de boutons" tout à gauche et cliquez sur l'éditeur d'équations.

Title: How do I write content in LaTeX on De Vinci Learning?
Content: In the text editor, click on the "Show more" button on the far left and click on the equation editor.

Title: Comment l'évaluateur est informé du rendu d'un devoir ?
Content: Dans DVL, les évaluateurs sont automatiquement informés des rendus de devoirs via les notifications du système. Vous n'avez pas besoin de les informer manuellement.

Title: How is the assessor informed when an assignment is due?
Content: In Moodle, assessors are automatically informed of assignments via system notifications. You don't need to inform them manually.

Title: Comment modifier un dépôt de devoir dans De Vinci Learning ?
Content: La fonctionnalité "Modifier le travail remis" dans DVL permet aux étudiants de soumettre une nouvelle version de leur travail. Il suffit de cliquer sur "Modifier le travail remis" à côté de la soumission initiale, charger la nouvelle version et cliquer sur "Enregistrer les modifications". L'enseignant a également cette fonctionnalité et peut aussi modifier un travail remis par l'étudiant lorsqu'il consulte les travaux rendus en cliquant sur "Consulter tous les travaux remis" puis en face du travail à modifier cliquer sur "Modifier" > "Modifier le travail"

Title: How do I modify an assignment repository in Vinci Learning?
Content: The "Modify submitted work" feature in DVL allows students to submit a new version of their work. Simply click on "Edit submision" next to the original submission, load the new version and click on "Save changes". The teacher also has this feature and can modify a student's submitted work when viewing the submitted work by clicking on "View all submissions" then next to the work to be modified click on "Edit" > "Edit submission".

Title: Peut-on insérer un fichier en glisser-déposer (drag 'n drop) dans De Vinci Learning ?
Content: Oui, une zone de dépôt manuelle de fichiers est prévue par DVL. Vous pouvez consulter l'information sur comment ajouter des documents sur ajouter un fichier ou consulter une vidéo de démonstration.

Title: Can I drag and drop a file into De Vinci Learning?
Content: Yes, DVL provides a manual file deposit area. You can view information on how to add documents at add a file or view a demonstration video.

Title: Quels types de fichiers puis-je déposer dans De Vinci Learning ?
Content: DVL permet de déposer une grande variété de types de fichiers. Seulement les fichiers PDF et vidéo peuvent être visibles de manière intégrée dans DVL. Les autres fichiers, PPT, Word, Excel, s'ouvriront dans une autre fenêtre ou pourront être téléchargés. Pour ajouter, par exemple une image, dans la zone de traitement de texte, cliquez sur l'icône image et suivez les étapes pour ajouter une image de notre cours Créer un cours dans DVL.

Title: What types of files can I upload to De Vinci Learning?
Content: DVL supports a wide variety of file types. Only PDF and video files can be viewed in DVL. Other files, such as PPT, Word and Excel, will open in another window or can be downloaded. To add an image, for example, in the word processing area, click on the image icon and follow the steps to add an image from our course Creating a course in DVL.

Title: Je n'arrive pas à retrouver mon cours ?
Content: Il est très probable qu'un cours n'apparaisse pas dans le bloc de recherche sur votre tableau de bord. Essayez tout d'abord de cliquer sur le bouton "réinitialiser" afin de retirer les filtres qui pourraient entrer en conflit avec votre recherche. Si malgré tout le cours n'apparait pas, nous vous invitions à nous contacter pour que nous vérifions s'il ne s'agit pas d'un problème d'inscription / synchronisation avec notre système d'information.

Title: I can't find my course?
Content: It is very likely that a course does not appear in the search block on your dashboard. First try clicking on the "reset" button to remove any filters that may conflict with your search. If the course still doesn't appear, we invite you to contact us so that we can check whether there is a problem with registration / synchronization with our information system.

Title: En cycle master, un CDI peut-il valider un stage?
Content: Non, en cycle master, les CDI ne sont pas autorisés.

Title: As a Postgraduate student, is it possible to be hired on a permanent contract?
Content: Permanent contracts are not allowed.

Title: En cycle master, est-il possible d'obtenir plusieurs conventions de stage au cours de la même année scolaire?
Content: Non, a l’exception des césures, une seule convention de stage peut être délivrée par année scolaire.

Title: As a Postgraduate student, is it possible to work as an intern several times within the same academic year?
Content: Only one contract can be signed per academic year, unless you are enrolled in a gap year.

Title: Quelle est la durée minimum requise d'un stage validant l'expérience international?
Content: Afin que le stage valide l'international il doit durer 17 semaines.

Title: What is the minimum requirement to fulfil a semester abroad as an intern?
Content: A semester abroad must last 17 weeks.

Title: En cycle master, comment le stage est-il évalué?
Content: Pour que le stage soit validé, trois notes sont nécessaires: •soutenance •rapport de stage •évalaution entreprise Si une des trois notes est inférieure à 6 ou si la moyenne des trois est inférieure à 10, le stage est invalidé. Dans ce cas, vous devrez rélaisé un nouveau satge en semestre supplémentaire (S11).

Title: As a Postgraduate student, how am I being assessed during my internship?
Content: As a trainee, you will be assessed three times: - by your mentor in the workplace through an evaluation form - by your school tutor regarding your writing and academic skills displayed in your dissertation - by your school tutor regarding your speaking skills showcased during a dissertation defense If one of these three items is worth less than 6/20, or if the overall grade is worth less than 10/20, then the internship semester will be "failed". In this case, the student will have to work as an intern during an additional semester (S11).

Title: Comment sont répartis les crédits pour le stage d'année 5?
Content: Désormais, en A5, il y a une partie approfondissement scientifique qui compte pour 8 ects. Le sujet est à définir en début du stage en accord avec le tuteur école et les livrables sont contenus dans le rapport.

Title: How many ECTS is Year 5 worth?
Content: From now on, Year 5 students must write a dissertation chapter displaying a state of the art worth 8 ECTS. The topic must be discussed at the beginning of the internship with your academic tutor, and the results must be included in the dissertation.

Title: Est-il possible d'effectuer les deux stages de master en structure de recherche?
Content: Oui, mais attention, si vos deux stages de master sont effectués en structure de recherche, vous devez effectuer 14 semaines supplémentaires en entreprise à la fin de votre cursus (sauf si vous avez déjà effectué 14 semaines pour votre stage A2/A3),

Title: Is it possible to work as a intern in a research department twice during my academic journey?
Content: If two of your Postgraduate internships are tied to a research department, then you must work an additional 14 weeks in a business environment at the end of your last academic year. If you have already worked for 14 weeks as a trainee in a busines environment during your undergraduate years, then this will not be necessary.

Title: Si je dois participer à un évènement entreprise sur un jour école, quelle est la procédure?
Quelles sont les conditions pour effectuer une mobilité internationale?
Content: •La mobilité internationale doit s'effectuer dans un pays sécurisé (couleur vert et jaune clair dans France diplomatie) •Elle doit être réalisée dans une période entreprise •Les missions doivent être en lien avec votre formation •La convention doit être signée par tous les partis avant votre départ •L'ensemble des conventions est disponible sur la plateforme dans la partie dédiée aux documents. •La durée peut être de 9 semaines minimum cumulables

Title: What are the conditions for participating in an international mobility program?
Content: The international mobility must take place in a secure country (indicated as green or light yellow on France Diplomatie). • It must be carried out during a company period. • The tasks must be related to your course of study. • The agreement must be signed by all parties before your departure. • All agreements are available on the platform in the section dedicated to documents. • The minimum duration of the mobility is 9 weeks, and the weeks can be accumulated.

Title: Que dois-je faire en cas d'oubli d'émargement?
Content: Seul un mail de votre enseignant attestant votre présence pourra justifier votre absence. Dans ce cas, vous devrez le déposer sur la plateforme dans l'espace dédié aux absence.

Title: What should I do in case of forgetting to sign the attendance sheet?
Content: Only an email from your teacher confirming your presence will justify your absence. In this case, you must upload the email to the platform in the section dedicated to absences

Title: My learning log is not complete; what should I do?
Content: You are responsible for monitoring and ensuring the completion of your learning log. Do not hesitate to follow up with your tutors for this matter. You must ensure that your apprenticeship supervisor has access to the portal (an email was sent to them at the beginning of the year). You need to coordinate the exchanges between your school tutor and your apprenticeship supervisor. It is essential that each step is signed by all parties (blue check). In case of issues, contact alternance-esilv@devinci.fr. Reminder: ECTS credits are assigned to your learning log, which is required for obtaining your diploma.
